title: Improvements to docs and merged the wiki
body:
This pull request significantly improves contributor and build documentation for SkiaSharp. It introduces a comprehensive `CONTRIBUTING.md` guide, expands quick references in existing docs, and adds a new guide for creating libraries. These changes clarify the contribution process, build instructions, and project structure for both new and experienced contributors.

**Contributor Documentation Improvements:**

* Added a detailed `CONTRIBUTING.md` file covering issue reporting, pull request guidelines, code standards, and build instructions.
* Updated `README.md` to include a new "Contributing" section with links to the new guide and summarized contributor resources.
* Added a "Contributing" quick link in `AGENTS.md` for easy access.

**Build and Maintainer Documentation:**

* Added references in `AGENTS.md` and `design/README.md` to new and existing maintainer and build guides in the `wiki/` directory. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-a54ff182c7e8acf56acfd6e4b9c3ff41e2c41a31c9b211b2deb9df75d9a478f9R150-R156) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-7a08ff7823f72212ed396d3fd4b0fe5a729e7bf9aecd229a49617627aede48f9L209-R224)
* Improved build instructions and links in `README.md` for both managed and native code builds.

**API and Library Development Guides:**

* Substantially rewrote and reorganized `design/adding-new-apis.md` to clarify the multi-layer API binding process, add a hands-on example, and highlight critical decisions and file locations. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-631db0cae7f7a7b01c55dea5e09776e6e04661db91c08492ae4663c2a14ac865L3-R86) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-631db0cae7f7a7b01c55dea5e09776e6e04661db91c08492ae4663c2a14ac865R95-R108)
* Added a new `design/creating-new-libraries.md` guide explaining project structure, versioning, strong naming, and NuGet packaging for new libraries.
* Updated `design/README.md` to include the new library creation guide and improve the documentation index.

These changes make it easier for contributors to get started, understand project organization, and follow best practices when contributing code or documentation.
